title: Why does LW feel so weak?
body: I use to always get LW as a must third item on Rengar but now it seems to be just useless and not worth the cost. Did the changes really screw it up that much?

replies.body:
Hi Mr Pine,

It is the bonus armour change. However good news we added flat ArP to Maw. This means first 3 items can be like Warrior, Hydra, Youmuu's / Maw and have flat penetration. It also means you can get both of them in your build fairly easily, making it great to assassinate squishies.

LW is good if top and jungle have double armour items. Otherwise I'd focus on flat pen and taking out the carries.

Hope that kinda answers.

Cheers,
Awh much sucky, Maw is too expensive to rush the thing that made LW so good was it was very cheap aha thanks for the idea tho :P
at least armour pen marks might be a better choice. 9 marks gives you 11.5 armour pen, which is pretty ok for a flat value

Filthy Rengar main here. As the others have said, Last Whisper got retooled to be an anti-tank measure rather than a unilateral damage boost. 

I'd definitely go for flat armor pen reds and quints on Rengar now. Combined with the +20 armor pen on Youmuu's and Warrior Enchantment, it should be enough to still destroy most squishies.

My typical Rengar build is Skirmisher's Sabre > Warrior > Boots of Lucidity > Tiamat > Youmuu's.
Armor pen runes.. hmm i've tried that (actually dedicated a whole page to that) i feel like it sacrifices too much early game pressure since i mostly top rengar.
Actually its better for top Rengar then jg, most toplaners have high base armour anyway

Armor pen tends to be stronger in the late laning phase than AD, you just struggle with last hitting a tad more. Flat AD is actually MORE effective against big tanks than flat armor pen, because of the way armor scaling works.
lol, you will have to tell me about it sometime
I take two apen quints so I can roll with 10% cdr thanks to blues and my last quint (I also run flat hp yellows)

I see Last Whisper or either of its upgrades getting built about 1% of the time on AD assassins (WHO KNOW WHAT THEY ARE DOING, honestly seeing someone build LW first or second is a dead giveaway of someone trying out a free rotation champ), and almost never on ADCs. It is only ever worth it if half the enemy team has 2-3 armor items EACH. Seriously every other armor pen item is better in almost all situations:

Enemies got low-ish bonus armor items like {{item:3157}}  or {{item:3047}} ? 
get {{item:3142}} 

Enemies got lots of high base armor like {{champion:44}} , {{champion:54}}  or {{champion:33}} , and/or are stacking armor?
get {{item:3071}} . You aren't going to burst them if you had {{item:3035}} anyway, why not get Black Cleaver and get 20% CDR, Rage passive and get 30 more AD (15 more than {{item:3033}} and {{item:3036}}).
The armor pen numbers are in favor of Black cleaver: up to 30% TOTAL Armor Pen vs. 30%-40% BONUS Armor Pen. Oh and Black Cleavers armor pen? IT SHREDS ARMOR FOR YOUR TEAM HAS WELL. As an AD assassin, you have done something that you thought you would never do, assist your ADC into doing more damage.
{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}} 

Seriously though, LW and both upgrades are going to be the seasons past Zeyphyr and Gunisoos of this season, they have no place in at all on any champ.

Combining Youmuuus, Black Cleaver and Armor Pen Marks and Quints seems to work best for all the AD Tear Gods that I play anyway {{champion:110}} {{champion:6}} {{champion:126}} , and I would image it would work well on AD assassins like {{champion:107}} {{champion:91}} {{champion:238}} 

The odd one of the bunch has to be{{item:3156}}. Back in season 5, this was an assassin's defensive item. Now it is just weird, sure most of the stats are nice, but only 10 armor pen? Bump that up to 15 I reckon, make the upgrade from {{item:3134}} worth something.

And of cause the removal of armor pen from {{item:1400}} {{item:1408}} {{item:1412}} now makes it the poor man's version of {{item:3142}}, but undoubtedly 10 CDR is more useful than 10 Armor pen for junglers, especially of the manaless variety.

It's because it only ignores bonus armour now. It's only really something to consider if you're trying to whittle down a tank with 300 armour, it's nigh on pointless to buy if you're trying to assassinate an ADC.
Mhm you're right I normally dont buy it till like 40 minutes in and we vsing mostly tanks anymore :(
